revision.text:
{{short description|2018 single by Justin Timberlake}} {{Infobox song | name = Filthy | cover = Justin Timberlake - Filthy (Official Single Cover).png | type = single | artist = [[Justin Timberlake]] | album = [[Man of the Woods]] | released = {{start date|2018|01|05|mf=yes}} | format = {{hlist|[[Music download|Digital download]]|[[Streaming media|streaming]]}} | genre = <!--Genres are sourced in the prose.-->{{hlist|[[Electro (music)|Electro-funk]]|[[Contemporary R&B|R&B]]}} | length = {{unbulleted list|4:53 {{small|(album version)}}|4:13 {{small|(radio edit)}}}} | label = [[RCA Records|RCA]] | writer = {{hlist|[[Justin Timberlake]]|[[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]]|[[James Fauntleroy]]|[[Danja (record producer)|Floyd Nathaniel Hills]]|[[Timbaland|Timothy Mosley]]}} | producer = {{hlist|Justin Timberlake|[[Timbaland]]|[[Danja (record producer)|Danja]]}} | prev_title = [[Can't Stop the Feeling!]] | prev_year = 2016 | next_title = [[Supplies (song)|Supplies]] | next_year = 2018 | misc = {{External music video|{{YouTube|gA-NDZb29I4|"Filthy"}}}} }} "'''Filthy'''" is a song by American singer-songwriter [[Justin Timberlake]]. It was released on January 5, 2018, as the [[lead single]] from his fifth studio album, ''[[Man of the Woods]]'' (2018). The [[Electro (music)|electro-funk]] song was written and produced by Timberlake, [[Timbaland]], and [[Danja (record producer)|Danja]], with additional songwriting from [[James Fauntleroy]] and [[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]].<ref name="variety">{{cite news|last=Aswad|first=Jem|title=Justin Timberlake to Drop Four Videos Before 'Man of the Woods' Album Release|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/justin-timberlake-to-drop-four-videos-before-man-of-the-woods-album-release-1202652093/|accessdate=January 4, 2018|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> Its music video was released on same day, which is set at a futuristic technology conference and shows Timberlake staging a [[Proof of concept|proof-of-concept]] demo for a robot.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.grammy.com/grammys/news/justin-timberlake-releases-filthy-music-video|title=Justin Timberlake Releases "Filthy" Music Video|last=Merrill|first=Philip|date=January 5, 2018|work=Grammys|accessdate=January 6, 2018}}</ref> It was serviced to [[contemporary hit radio]] on January 9, 2018. "Filthy" debuted at number 9 on the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], becoming Timberlake's 18th top 10 on the chart as a soloist,<ref name="hot100">{{Cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/8094379/ed-sheeran-bruno-mars-cardi-b-justin-timberlake-hot-100-top-10|title=Ed Sheeran's 'Perfect' Rules Hot 100, Bruno Mars & Cardi B's 'Finesse' Flies to No. 3 & Justin Timberlake's 'Filthy' Debuts at No. 9|last=Trust|first=Gary|date=January 16, 2018|work=Billboard|accessdate=January 16, 2018}}</ref> and reached the top 5 in Canada.
==Production== "Filthy" was revealed as the first single the day after ''Man of the Woods'' was confirmed. Timberlake, Timbaland and Danja first collaborated on ''[[FutureSex/LoveSounds]]''. All three artists co-wrote the song along with [[James Fauntleroy]], who co-wrote all songs on ''[[The 20/20 Experience]]'' and all but two songs on ''[[The 20/20 Experience â€“ 2 of 2]]'' and [[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]] of production team [[1500 or Nothin']].<ref>{{cite news|title=Timbaland and Danja Produced Justin Timberlake's New Song "Filthy"|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2018/01/timbaland-danja-produced-justin-timberlake-filthy-new-song/|accessdate=January 4, 2018|work=[[XXL (magazine)|XXL]]|first=Peter A.|last=Berry|date=January 3, 2018}}</ref>
{{quote|"I like to think of "Filthy" as the disruption between the world we're living in and his world. The world that he's living in with his family, his friends that he came up with, his musical roots and everything. We're gonna go into, easily, the other type of feelings and vibes of his album that were kind of presented in the trailer... [It] is the kind of in-between thing, that jump-off thing that kinda wipes the palette clean for him to be able to tell the story that he wants to tell. I can't say that "Filthy" was described in the trailer, but "Filthy" played its role in the whole album."|Danja in a conversation with ''[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]'' on why "Filthy" opens ''Man of the Woods''.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.complex.com/music/2018/01/danja-interview-justin-timberlake-filthy-man-of-the-woods |title=Producer Danja Explains Why Justin Timberlake's "Filthy" Doesn't Sound Like A Country Song |last=Tharpe |first=Frazier |date=January 7, 2018 |work=Complex |access-date=January 10, 2018}}</ref>}}
Recording for "Filthy" was handled by Danja and Timbaland. The duo worked on the song in a separate studio, while Timberlake worked between two other studios, which had [[Chad Hugo]] and [[Pharrell Williams]] of [[The Neptunes]] in one room, and [[Rob Knox (producer)|Rob Knox]] of [[The Y's]] and [[Eric Hudson]] in the other. Timberlake would compose certain sections of the song in his head, as he did in the ''FutureSex/LoveSounds'' sessions as well. Danja added screams, moans and breaths into the song, as well as the sound of a lion roaring. While the breakdown was conceptualised by Timberlake - Timbaland and Danja would create the breakdown as Timberlake would sing the melody. Danja also experimented with the idea of [[hi-hats]] in the song but felt that they didn't "...feel right. It dates it, puts it into a place of what's happening right now. That's not where you want to be."<ref>https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/justin-timberlake-producer-danja-talks-filthy-w515205</ref>
==Composition== "Filthy" is an [[electro (music)|electro funk]]<ref name="ew">{{cite news|url=http://ew.com/music/2018/01/05/justin-timberlake-single-filthy-released|title=Hear Justin Timberlake's new electric-funk song 'Filthy'|last=Brown|first=Eric Renner|date=January 5, 2018|work=Entertainment Weekly|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> and [[Contemporary R&B|R&B]] song.<ref name="the guardian"/> The song comprises funky electro-R&B elements.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.vibe.com/2018/01/justin-timberlake-filthy-stream/|title=Justin Timberlake Maintains A Funky Groove With New Single, "Filthy"|last=Thompson|first=Desire|date=January 5, 2018|work=Vibe|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' noted the song is a combination of [[Arena rock|anthemic rock]] with electro.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/news/8092692/justin-timberlake-future-filthy-video-watch|title=Justin Timberlake Goes Back to the Future for 'Filthy' Music Video: Watch|last=Bradle|first=Lars|date=January 5, 2018|work=Billboard|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> The track opens with guitar licks, and it morphs into a "sleekly" industrial neo-funk number, complete with synth and a "snaking" bassline.<ref name="nme"/> Timberlake speaks/sings [[tongue-in-cheek]] lyrics during the track.<ref name="billboard"/> As noted by ''[[Rolling Stone]]''{{'}}s Elias Leight, Timberlake keeps his voice in the middle of mix, "so the singer and the music are equal partners."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/features/justin-timberlake-producer-danja-talks-filthy-w515205 |title=Justin Timberlake Producer Danja Talks Making the Wild, Futuristic 'Filthy' |last=Leight |first=Elias |date=January 9, 2018 |work=Rolling Stone |access-date=January 10, 2018}}</ref> The outro features vocals from [[Jessica Biel]].<ref name="variety review">{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/music/news/justin-timberlake-filthy-video-review-1202654303/|title=Song Review: Justin Timberlake Goes Back to the 'FutureSounds' With 'Filthy' Video|last=Willman|first=Chris|date=January 5, 2018|work=Variety|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> The song was written in the key of [[A-flat Minor]], with Timberlake's vocals spanning from Eb3 to Ab4.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtd.asp?ppn=MN0180873|title=Justin Timberlake â€“ Filthy Sheet Music (Digital Download)|publisher=Musicnotes.com. [[Universal Music Publishing Group]]|accessdate=January 23, 2018}}</ref>
==Critical reception== ''[[The Guardian]]'' journalist Ben Beaumont-Thomas gave the song five-out-of-five stars, and said in his review, "On the basis of Filthy, he absolutely can. Beginning with some bombastic guitar rock, it transmogrifies into a beautifully dark, undulating funk track underpinned by a whiplash bass womp". He described the song as a "grownup funk masterpiece," and added "the chorus, which modulates into a sweeter, smoother key, is signature Timberlake."<ref name="the guardian">{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/culture/2018/jan/05/justin-timberlake-filthy-review?CMP=share_btn_tw|title=Justin Timberlake: Filthy review â€“ comeback single channels Prince into grownup funk masterpiece|last=Beaumont-Thomas|first=Ben|date=January 5, 2017|work=The Guardian|accessdate=January 5, 2017}}</ref> In ''[[XXL (magazine)|XXL]]'', C. Vernon Coleman II stated the production provides a "fitting soundscape for the single, as they deploy out of this world synths with pulsating [[Roland TR-808|808s]]."<ref name="xxl">{{cite news|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/rap-music/new-music/2018/01/timbaland-danja-justin-timberlake-filthy/|title=Timberlake, Timbaland and Danja Reunite In New Track 'Filthy'|date=January 5, 2018|work=XXL|accessdate=January 5, 2018|first=C. Vernon|last=Coleman II}}</ref> In ''[[NME]]'', Larry Barleet reacted positively, stating "Timberlake pulls it off," and adding "what's really brilliant about 'Filthy' is that it's proof that JT isn't done with innovating."<ref name="nme">{{cite news|url=http://www.nme.com/blogs/nme-blogs/justin-timberlake-filthy-track-review-2206682|title=In search of the filth in Justin Timberlake's 'Filthy'|last=Larry|first=Barleet|date=January 5, 2017|work=NME|accessdate=January 5, 2017}}</ref> Also from ''NME'', Nick Reily described the track as "futuristic".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nme.com/news/music/justin-timberlake-returns-new-single-filthy-2206657|title=Justin Timberlake returns with futuristic new single 'Filthy'|last=Reily|first=Nick|date=January 5, 2018|work=NME|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> ''[[Rap-Up]]'' opined the "dance-ready" track finds the team experimenting with "a new futuristic sound."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2018/01/04/new-music-justin-timberlake-filthy/|title=New Music: Justin Timberlake - Filthy|date=January 5, 2018|work=Rap-Up|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> Christopher R. Weingarten of ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' said it is "hard" to call the song pop "since the production is so [[avant-garde]]." He further commented the producers Timbaland and Danja "conjure a testosterone electronic chainsaw grind and match it with vintage [[Larry Graham]]-style slap bass: The fact that the two musical elements don't exactly match groovewise creates a beautiful and disorienting tension unlike anything on the radio."<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/justin-timberlakes-man-of-the-woods-album-review-w516240 |title=Review: Justin Timberlake Heads for the Country (Sort of) on 'Man of the Woods' |last=Weingarten |first=Christopher R. |date=February 2, 2018 |work=Rolling Stone |accessdate=February 2, 2018}}</ref>
Ed Masley of ''[[The Arizona Republic]]'' described it as a "suitably robotic, an electro-funk sex jam."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/entertainment/music/2018/01/04/best-january-singles-playlist-2018-new-music/1006475001/|title=Justin Timberlake just dropped the video to 'Filthy' from 'Man of the Woods'|last=Masley|first=Ed|date=January 4, 2018|work=The Arizona Central|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> Chris Willman of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' thought the single and visuals in the context of the album may represent Timberlake's former self "albeit one who's clearly still capable of coming to the phone, still getting his sexy-back kicks in before the muse draws him into a more reflective forest."<ref name="variety review"/> In ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'', Katie Atkinson ranked it 11 among all Timberlake's singles, and felt "the funky Timbaland beat and [[tongue-in-cheek]] lyrics were a welcome, loose surprise."<ref name="billboard">{{Cite news |url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/7357881/justin-timberlake-singles-ranked |title=Every Justin Timberlake Single Ranked: Critic's Choice |last=Atkinson |first=Katie |date=January 5, 2017 |work=Billboard |access-date=January 5, 2017}}</ref> [[Jon Caramanica]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' opined it is an "unimaginative but slyly effective electro-funk vamp with [[acid house]] accents... It's cyclical and deliberate, like late-1970s [[Big band|big-band]] [[soul music]]."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/05/arts/music/playlist-justin-timberlake-bruno-mars-kendrick-lamar.html|title=The Playlist: Justin Timberlake Stays Funky (for Now), and 9 More New Songs|last=Caramanica|first=Jon|date=January 5, 2018|work=The New York Times|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> In [[The Ringer (website)|The Ringer]], Lindsay Zoladz opined it "sounds like a new-millennium update of [[David Bowie]]'s "[[Fame (David Bowie song)|Fame]]."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theringer.com/music/2018/1/5/16854100/justin-timberlake-filthy-man-of-the-woods|title=Justin Timberlake Gets "Filthy" and Stays Funky|last=Zoladz|first=Lindsay|date=January 5, 2018|work=The Ringer|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> Bryan Rolli of ''[[The Daily Dot]]'' said the song "sounds right at home next to other JT smash hits such as "[[Suit & Tie]]" and "[[SexyBack]]," while the singer "delivers a sensual, understated vocal performance."<ref name="dot">{{Cite news |url=https://www.dailydot.com/upstream/justin-timberlake-steve-jobs-filthy-video/ |title=Justin Timberlake emulates Steve Jobs in new 'Filthy' video |last=Rolli |first=Bryan |date=January 5, 2018 |work=The Daily Dot |access-date=January 10, 2018}}</ref> Radio station [[Capital (radio network)|Capital FM]] listed it among the seven best songs, and [[Capital XTRA]] included it among the best R&B songs, of the first bimester of 2018.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.capitalfm.com/videos/playlists/best-pop-songs-2018/|title=The 7 Best Pop Songs Of 2018... So Far|date=February 9, 2018|work=Capital FM|accessdate=April 22, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.capitalxtra.com/playlists/best-2018/rnb-songs/|title=The Best R&B Songs Of 2018 So Far|work=Capital Xtra|accessdate=April 22, 2018}}</ref>
Other writers expressed unfavorable opinions. In ''[[Pitchfork (website)|Pitchfork]]'', Katherine St. Asaph criticized its lyrics and sound.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://pitchfork.com/reviews/tracks/justin-timberlake-filthy/|title="Filthy" by Justin Timberlake Review - Pitchfork|website=pitchfork.com|accessdate=7 January 2018}}</ref> Will Lavin of [[Joe (website)|Joe]] thought it sounds "dated, clunky and out of touch."<ref>{{cite news|last=Lavin|first=Will|title=Watch the video for Justin Timberlake's disappointing new single, "Filthy"|url=https://www.joe.co.uk/entertainment/watch-the-video-for-justin-timberlakes-disappointing-new-single-filthy-155747|date=January 5, 2017|work=Joe|accessdate=January 7, 2017}}</ref> Eric Renner of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' called it "empty" and said it is a "stuttering mess of electronic and funk".<ref name="ew"/>
==Music video== [[File:Filthy music video by Justin Timberlake.png|thumb|upright=1.1|In its first scenes, Al [[Actuator|mimics]] his creator's moves on stage.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.vulture.com/2018/01/see-justin-timberlakes-robot-dance-in-filthy-music-video.html|title=Watch Justin Timberlake Show Off His Robot Dance in 'Filthy' Music Video|last=Wright|first=Tolly|date=January 5, 2018|work=Vulture|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref>]] Timberlake shared a teaser of the video on January 4.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://ew.com/music/2018/01/04/justin-timberlake-steve-jobs-filthy-video-tease/|title=Justin Timberlake channels Steve Jobs in 'Filthy' video tease|last=Brown|first=Eric Renner|date=January 4, 2018|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=January 4, 2018}}</ref> The official music video was directed by [[Mark Romanek]] and premiered along with the song.<ref name="variety"/> Timberlake plays an inventor introducing his new work, a robot named Al, to the public.<ref>{{cite news|last=Kaufman|first=Gil|title=Justin Timberlake to Drop 'Filthy' Single on Jan. 5|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8085934/justin-timberlake-new-song-filthy-release-date-man-of-the-woods|accessdate=January 4, 2018|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> As a character inspired by [[Steve Jobs]], Timberlake takes the stage at the Pan-Asian Deep Learning Conference in [[Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia]], in 2028 and debuts Al. In the dance-centric visual,<ref>{{cite news|title=Justin Timberlake Readies Timbaland-Produced Single 'Filthy'|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2018/01/03/justin-timberlake-readies-timbaland-produced-single-filthy/|accessdate=January 4, 2018|work=[[Rap-Up]]|date=January 3, 2018}}</ref> the [[artificial intelligence]] machine displays dance moves while being remotely manipulated by Timberlake.<ref name="xxl"/> As the video progresses, Al performs more elaborate and [[Eroticism|erotic]] dance moves with the dancers, being rewarded with an enthusiastic ovation from the previously expressionless audience.<ref name="dot"/> The line between creator and his invention blurs by the clip's end, as described by a ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' reviewer.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/watch-justin-timberlakes-futuristic-new-filthy-video-w514888|title=Watch Justin Timberlake's Futuristic New 'Filthy' Video|last=Reed|first=Ryan|date=January 5, 2018|work=Rolling Stone|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> For the [[Computer-generated imagery|CGI]] character, Timberlake and several dancers performed the motions that became Al's moves in the final product.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop/8093006/justin-timberlake-filthy-video-behind-the-scenes-instagram|title=Justin Timberlake Gives a Glimpse at the Making of His 'Filthy' Video|work=Billboard|date=January 6, 2018|accessdate=January 7, 2018|first=Ashley|last=Iasimone}}</ref>
About Timberlake's outfit in the video, Rachel Hahn of ''[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]'' deemed it a modern version of Jobs' iconic look. Timberlake wears a [[Todd Snyder (fashion designer)|Todd Snyder]] [[Polo neck|turtleneck]] with wire-frame glasses, a pair of gray pants, and classic white sneakers.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/justin-timberlake-filthy-music-video-man-of-the-woods-dancing-robot-steve-jobs-tech-outfit|title=In "Filthy," Justin Timberlake Upgrades Steve Jobs's Iconic Uniform|last=Hahn|first=Rachel|date=January 5, 2018|work=Vogue|accessdate=January 5, 2018}}</ref> "Filthy" received a nomination for an [[MTV Video Music Award for Best Choreography]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/cardi-b-the-carters-childish-gambino-drake-lead-2018-vma-nominations-699523/|title=VMAs 2018: Cardi B, the Carters, Childish Gambino, Drake Lead Nominations|date=July 16, 2018|accessdate=July 17, 2018|first=Ryan|last=Reed|work=Rolling Stone}}</ref>
== Credits and personnel == {{Div col}} *[[Justin Timberlake]] â€“ production, vocal production *[[Timbaland]] â€“ production *[[Danja (record producer)|Danja]] â€“ production *[[Chris Stapleton]] â€“ guitar *[[1500 or Nothin'|Larrance Dopson]] â€“ keyboard *Chris Godbey â€“ engineer *Ben Sedano â€“ assistant engineering *[[Jessica Biel]] â€“ additional vocals *Elliot Ives â€“ guitar {{div col end}}

Peak<br />position |- {{singlechart|Australia|27|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 20, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Austria|42|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 17, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Flanders|17|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 13, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Wallonia|50|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 13, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Canada|5|artist=Justin Timberlake|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 17, 2018}} |- ! scope="row"| Colombia ([[National Report]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.national-report.com/top-colombia/#tab-1|title=Top 100 Colombia|language=Spanish|publisher=[[National Report]]|accessdate=July 22, 2019|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180216072249/http://www.national-report.com/top-colombia/|archive-date=February 16, 2018}}</ref> | 44 |- {{singlechart|Czechdigital|23|year=2018|week=02|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 16, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Denmark|24|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 17, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|France|19|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 13, 2017}} |- {{singlechart|Germany2|42|songid=1723432|artist=Justin Timberlake|song=Filthy|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 12, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Hungarysingle|11|year=2018|week=2|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 18, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Hungarystream|19|year=2018|week=2|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 18, 2018}} |- {{singlechart|Ireland3|22|artist=Justin Timberlake|rowheader=true|accessdate=January 13, 2018}} |- ! scope="row"| Italy ([[Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana|FIMI]])<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fimi.it/classifiche#/category:digital/id:2613|title=Top Singoli â€“ Classifica settimanale WK 2|publisher=[[Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana]]|language=Italian|accessdate=January 13, 2018}}</ref> | 55 |- {{singlechart|Billboardjapanhot100|42|artist=Justin Timberlake|rowheader=true|accessdate=March 12, 2020}} |- ! scope="row"| [[Mexico Airplay]] (''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'')<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/biz/charts/2018-01-27/mexico|title=Mexico Airplay: Jan 27, 2018|work=Billboard|accessdate=May 16, 2018|url-access=subscription }}</ref> | 22 |- !
